page.title: 01Introduction-Medbourne Area.
page.content: This block is a mainly rural district lying along and adjacent to part of the Welland Valley on the border of S.E. Leicestershire and Northamptonshire. In recent years the countryside has changed from being predominately pastureland to a mixed farming area. Each year more and more fields fall under the plough. The three communities included are Medbourne (pop.560), Drayton (pop.145) and Nevill Holt (pop.40). Most residents commute to work by car as the bus service is very sparse. The main road is the B664 from Market Harborough to Uppingham with minor roads joining the villages.As houses and travel become more expensive the average age of the communities increases because young married people cannot afford to stay.
